education.program: Master of Mathematics in Computer Science
Bachelor of Computer Science with Honours
Bachelor of Arts with a Major in Philosophy

experience.company: University of New Brunswick Human-Computer Interaction Lab

software.name: MyHealthNB
software.description: MyHealthNB provides digital access to personal healthcare records. With my company, VeroSource Solutions, I work to develop both the MyHealthNB web and native mobile applications. Photo from VeroSource solutions website.

software.name: Portfolio
software.description: A personal website developed from scratch using React with NextJS and Tailwind CSS. Hosted using GitHub pages.

software.name: Life Transition Journal
software.description: Life Transition Journal is a virtual task-based diary application to help users track what is important to them as they experience their first winter in Canada. Built for a University of Waterloo field study using React Native with Expo and deployed for iOS and Android devices using EAS. Back-end services built with PostgreSQL and Node.js.

research.name: "Comparing the Effects of Verbal and Nonverbal Robot Cues on Perceived Confidence"
research.description: Final project for University of Waterloo course ECE750 (Social Robotics). A survey study in which participants (n = 16) evaluated videos of a NAO robot. Included both a qualitative and quantitative data analysis.

research.name: "Using an Augmented Reality Exercise Game to Improve Exercise Experiences"
research.description: Final project for University of Waterloo course CS889 (Research Methods in HCI) completed with Aswad Tariq. An experiment study (n = 10) to evaluate if our gamified augmented reality system can improve user experiences of in-place exercises. Included both a qualitative and quantitative data analysis.
